description.p: You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. This bonus increases to +2 on 6th level and +3 on 14th level.

Whisper is a mythical dagger used as a symbolic artifact to be wielded by The Hand, an envoy of the Master of Lore of the College of Whispers. The dagger, and its various wielders, are rumored to be behind many assassinations, murders, rituals and other dark deeds thought history.

Mind Rend. Whenever a creature is struck with a critical hit from Whisper, the blade renders into its targets mind, projecting unspeakable horrors and disfiguring their surroundings. the target must make a DC 12 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened from every creature around it. On a success, they are immune to being frightened by this effect for the next 24 hours.

Weave Strike. While attuned to Whisper, the user can throw the blade at a target. When the blade is thrown, but before any attack roll is made, the wielder can choose to merge themselves into the weave, following the blade and teleporting instantly wherever it hits. If the target is a creature, the wielder emerges in a space of their choice adjacent to the target. If the wielder miss the attack roll, the DM determines where the wielder teleports accordingly. This ability can be used 2 + 1 times per proficiency level before needing a short rest.

A brass colored glove wraped in a chain whos end is connected to a glimerring and very sharp crystal shard.
The user can spend an action to cause thick, black, wyvern poison to coat the crystal. The weapon remains coated in poison for 1 minute or until an attack with this weapon hits another creature.

Finishing Touch. A creature that is hit by the crystal must succed on an DC 15 Constitution Saving Throw or take 7d6 poison damage, half as much on a successful save, and becomes poisoned for 1 minute. The dart can't be used this way again.

Pulling Touch. Additionaly, when you hit a creature, you can use a bonus action to pull it. The creature must suceed on a DC 10+ {{strength:modifier}} on be pulled up to 10 feer in a straight line toward you.

This black iron sword was forged in the black flames of the Shadofell and held by generations of Shadar-kai kithlords, the leaders of their societies. The sword imbued with powers that reflect the strongest abilites of the Shadar-Kai, in the name of the Raven Queen.
This sword has a maximuum of 9 charges, You can spend 1 charge to cast mirror image, misty step, or invisibility. You can use 2 charges to cast Blink or Greater Invisibility. The sword regains 1d8+1 charges at dawn.

Shadow Grip. The sword of the Umbral Abasador draw power from the Shadowfell in order to manipulate an enemy's own shadow, turning it against them. As an action you can spen 3 charges to force an enemy within 60 feet to make a DC 16 Strenght Saving Throw or be Paralized by tendrils of shadow. At the end of each of their turns, the target may repeat the saving throw, ending the effect of success.

A fancy sword awarded by The Justiciar Order to members who finish their training. The hilt is made from solid gold with two rubies embedded on each side of the wrist guard. Despite it's weight, the sword is extremely well balanced. The blade itself is well forged, keeping its sharp edge for a long time.
Perfect Balance. While wielding the sword the wielder gains advantage to Disarming Saving Throws against them.
In Times of Need. The sword has 4 cheap rubies, worth 250gp each. You can spend an hour removing a ruby from the hilt.
